comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: 

On Windows, WebGL should base which driver blacklist to use not on the Windows version, but on the *driver model* (XPDM vs WDDM).

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Install an XPDM driver on Vista or 7.

Actual Results:  
Windows version is used for blacklisting.

Expected Results:  
Driver model should be used for blacklisting.

comments.author: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com
comments.creator: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Can you please elaborate? Is there a specific example why this matters, or is this a general concern that bugs may be specific to one driver model and so our blacklisting should be aware of that?
comments.text: Can you please elaborate? Is there a specific example why this matters, or is this a general concern that bugs may be specific to one driver model and so our blacklisting should be aware of that?

comments.raw_text: I am talking about how different blacklists are currently used for XP vs Vista when the driver model should be used.
comments.author: yuhongbao_386@hotmail.com
comments.creator: yuhongbao_386@hotmail.com
comments.text: I am talking about how different blacklists are currently used for XP vs Vista when the driver model should be used.

comments.raw_text:
I see. Can you further explain why it's the driver model, not the OS version, that matters the most? Or should we use both?

(Yes, I really am clueless about this)

comments.text: The same XP graphics driver will have the same bugs whether it runs on XP, Vista, or 7.
